text: Un ptit bijou charmant au coeur du milex! Essai du cappucino et latté pour le moment! Je veux essayer leur dîner au plus vite!

Emplacement quasi secret qui vaut le détour, petit repas de sandwich/salades simples et délicieux, café du torréfacteur St-Henri, ambiance tranquille avec fond de musique bien choisie et belle sélection de vinyles à s'acheter. À y retourner!
If you go there, you need to try their chai latte! The best in that area and worth the $3.50! Not too sweet, not too milky and enough chai flavor!

Love this spot because it feels like I've taken myself on a little adventure even though it's just a few blocks from home. It's tucked in a parking lot across from the Home Depot on Beaubien, just past Diplomate, between St Laurent and Parc. Look for the little sandwich boards painted with the logo of a vinyl record being dipped in a coffee cup to lead you there.   I had a hibiscus juice on ice in a mason jar and a small delicious simple grilled cheese - each of these was about $3, not cheeaaappp but not pricey either, I was totally happy with the price and the deliciousness. I would have stayed longer if they served a filter coffee of some kind, pour over or in a pot, I'm just not so big on lattes or Americanos. The muffins looked delicious and I'd be happy to try a London Fog or chai next time.   I love the decor here, it's full of local art and stacks of records to dig through and a comfy little listening station at the front. There is free wifi and a couple tables outside in the parking lot. The service was friendly, chill, easily bilingual. All in all, loved the vibe, will be back soon.

J'ai beaucoup aimé cet endroit "caché"... super décor, frais, sympathique. On y retrouve une belle sélection de vinyls également. Le service était hyper convivial, bon thé, bonne bouffe, bonne ambiance. Je vais certainement y retourner prochainement.
